args:
The spread of the transient world is like the boughs
of a tree—utterly without end. This, then, is but a
possible small tale that could take place after the
prevention of the Tsukuyomi disaster.

Yes. In the wake of the mayhem with
Tsukuyomi, we Wyrmclan leaders have
poured our hearts and souls into calming
the upset in Hinomoto.
As a result, we have finally been able\nto reclaim some semblance of calm.\nBut alas, our duties do not end there.

The prime duty of the twelve Wyrmclan
leaders is, as shogun candidates, to make
this land ever more bounteous. Yet we are
all quite fatigued at the moment.
Indeed, we have been working nonstop\nsince the incident.

And nothing can be accomplished with
a worn and tired body, which is why I
propose that we Wyrmclan leaders
go on a hot springs trip.
We must needs cleanse the grime of the\nworld and recharge our spirits—and this\ncan only be accomplished at a hot spring!
(He's quite fired up about this. Of course,\nhe HAS always loved hot springs more\nthan anyone I know.)
I totally agree! Rest hard to work hard!\nVariety is the spice of life! And so on!
You never seem to make it to the ＂work\nhard＂ portion of that equation. However,\nI concur with the idea of hot springs.

We haven't seen any remnants of the
Mukuroshu in some time, and I've no
objections to this plan. However, what
is the trip to be like, exactly?
Well, since we can't all be resting at the\nsame time, we'll split into two groups\nand switch off.
The first group will be the Rat, Ox, Tiger,\nHorse, and Boar. And our destination is...
South Grastaea\nAquagi Village\nBeach and Hot Spring Resort
Ahhhh... Now that soothes the body.\nExcellent job finding this place, Ieyasu.

I'm most pleased that you like it. However,
I'm curious why you were so insistent
about coming here when we could have
found a hot spring in Hinomoto.

I'd actually planned to drop by this place
while I was on the journey to deliver
New Year's blessings, but with all the
Tsukuyomi hubbub, I missed my chance.
And besides, if we leave Hinomoto,\nthat will likely inspire growth in others.
General Shingen entrusted me with his\nprecious people and lands, and I'm gonna\ntake care of them SO HARD!
I will help as well, Lady Yukimura.

You all left things to your vassals in your
absences as well, I hope? Doing so will
help foster a sense of responsibility,
for wisdom comes only from hard work.
I would certainly expect such an ethos\nfrom a man like you who values personal\ngrowth above nearly all else.

By the way, Shingen. I know this place
has a permissive swimwear policy,
but maybe you wanna consider at least
removing the ol' helmet?
This helm is my identity, and I cannot so\nreadily be parted from it. Ha ha ha!
Well, that was a nice dip! And now that\nwe have enjoyed the warming waters...
It's banquet time! Let us eat, drink,\nand make merry as we forget the stress\nof our most transient world!
I removed the skin and small bones of\nthe fish so they wouldn't get caught\nin your throat, Lord Shingen.
Say, everyone. Since we have this fine\nopportunity, how about we have ourselves\na little heart-to-heart?

To be frank, we should decide who is most
suited to be the next shogun. We all are
both comrades and candidates, so surely
we're interested in each others' opinions?
Hmm. The shogunal successor is a topic\nof some intensity. Such opinions might\nwell cause sparks to fly.
But this is a party, which means disquiet\nand disrespect can simply be washed\naway as japes borne of the atmosphere.
Just so, Shingen. So then, everyone?\nWhat feelings burn deep in your hearts?
My stance burns right out in the open.\nBeing shogun would be a pain and I don't\nwanna do it, 'kay, thanks. NEXT!
The peace of the people is paramount to\nme. If I can achieve that, I have no\nparticular fixation on political positions.
Hmph. Well you all sure sound indifferent\nabout it.
You on the other hand seem highly\nenthusiastic.
Of course! My dream is to rule the entire\ncountry! What about you, Shingen?
I'll leave that to your imagination.
A fairly self-important way of putting it.\nTrying to confound us, perhaps?
Some things are better left unsaid, I think.\nNow then, Mitsuhide! I hear you have\nprepared some entertainment for us?

Ooo, is it time? Awesome! ...Ahem!
When I heard our next guest was touring
in the south, I had him adjust his schedule
just to be here tonight...
...Hanabusa? Hello? ...Well, that's weird.\nHe should be waiting right over there.
Uh oh. I worried this might happen.\nTummy trouble?
F-forgive me, Lady Mitsuhide. I know you\nentrusted me with this great responsibility,\nbut in this state, I—*guuurgle*
I heard the poor man was disposed to such\nsuffering. It seems the tension of the hour\nis giving him a case of the runs.
Great responsibility? He's dancing for a\nparty! Dude seriously needs to relax.

Yes, but a party for high-level individuals,
which is undoubtedly stressful. That being
said, this is bound to end in both misery
and many soiled pants, so... Hmm...
The party has become subdued...\nOh, and I had planned such a perfect\ndance for Lady Mitsuhide and the others!
I have no options left to me now save\nending my shameful life, so I suppose...\nHmm? I hear cheers from the party venue!
Movements swift as wind!\nA stance stately as the silent forest!
Passionate like fire! Making the earth sing\nlike a mountain! This is the heart of my\nFurinkazan dancing style!
While you were, er, ＂indisposed,＂\nShingen leapt into action.

One of my vassals is a master of
Hinomotoan dance, and I thought I
might take the opportunity to show off
what they taught me!
You call that dancing? It looked more like\nthe writhing of a fiend, or maybe a sumo\nwrestler toppling over the buffet table.
And yet it still livened up the party!\nSometimes perfection is not required\nfor a thing to be workable.

Now, Hanabusa! I hand it off to you!
There are not many dancers worse
than I, so you can but improve upon
my flailings.
I promise no one here will be so boorish\nas to critique your work, so please dance\nas your heart tells you.
I thank you, Lord Shingen. Though\nunworthy, I shall perform a dance before\nyour noble personages.
This time, Hanabusa's dance was graceful and\nmagnificent as a willow in the breeze.
Hrmm... Seems I got carried away and ate\ntoo much. Time for a brisk walk to get my\ndigestion moving again.
Ah, the sea at night... For one as I who\ngrew up in the mountains, it is a thing\nboth beautiful and frightful.
There is no best way to live, but there are\nthings that may come into view as a result\nof one's time being limited.
A truth I know well, Yoshitsune.\nWhich is why on this trip, I intend to...
